page.title: 08Faldingworth Village Shop
page.content: There is only one shop in {Faldingworth.}It is a post office and a general store selling groceries, fruit, vegetables, sweets, newspapers and magazines. The owners are Mr & Mrs Northing. The building is over a hundred years old and has been altered several times in it's history. The shop forms the front of the ground floor and the owners live in rooms behind and above the shop. The shop serves the local community and a large country area, the nearest other shops being at the{Virginia {Estate, Middle Rasen}and{Dunholme,}all at least three miles away. Years ago Mr Richardson had the shop, when a number of items e.g. flour, tea, sugar, butter, lard and salt which are now pre-packaged were delivered in bulk and had to be weighed into small packages.
